source_sentence: 不空羂索神變真言經卷第十六
translation: Bukong juansuo shenchang zhenyan jing, vol. 16

source_sentence: 大唐天竺三藏菩提流志譯
translation: Bodhiruci Transliteration of the Tripiṭaka of the Great Tang Dynasty

source_sentence: 一切菩薩敬禮解脫三昧耶真言品第二十七之二治地真言唵旖暮伽(上一)弭目乞灑曼拏攞(二)摩訶步嚲弭麼[口*(隸-木+士)](三)陀(上)囉陀(上)囉(四)地唎地唎(五)摩訶特步嚲加麼攞(六)旖弭嚲皤摩矩吒陀(上)囉(七)[合*牛][怡-台+巿]莎(二合)縛訶(八)是真言。
translation: 一切菩薩敬禮解脫三昧耶真言品第二十七之二治地真言唵旖暮伽(上一)弭目乞灑曼拏攞(二)摩訶步嚲弭麼[口*(隸-木+士)](三)陀(上)囉陀(上)囉(四)地唎地唎(五)摩訶特步嚲加麼攞(六)旖弭嚲皤摩矩吒陀(上)囉(七)[合*牛][怡-台+巿]莎(二合)縛訶(八)是真言。
"With the miraculous radiance of the King of Agitation.
It's a white mustard-seed perfume that's applied.
It scatters everywhere that an altar is built.
It then completely fills one yojana.
It's as pure as a bhāṭī-kāśyapa treasure.
If sentient beings walk on this altar site, they'll be born among the Pure Land after they abandon their lives.
They'll be reborn in the Pure Land after they abandon their lives.
They'll attain the great aggregate of merit that's associated with perfection.
They'll reach unsurpassed correct perfect enlightenment.
They'll never lose it again.
Suppose birds and animals walk on this spot.
They'll abandon their lives and be born in the upper heavenly realms.'
True Words for Healing Water

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)訥(二合)嚕莽攞嚲(二)弭理乞灑舍佉(三)鉢怛(二合)囉補澁簸叵攞(四)弭吒播嚕[可*欠]娜儞跢誐拏(五)補澁波迦哩搖(尼照反)縒(六)囉娜遜娜囉(七)跛(二合同上)囉塞(二合同上)囉縛拏(八)弭弭馱弭質怛(二合)囉(九)播哩輸(去)陀(上)野(十)鉢(二合)頭麼步惹(十一)娑(去)麼娑(去)麼(十二)三(去)曼諦娜(十三)播哩曼拏攞(十四)播哩輸(去)馱野(十五)摩攞麼攞(十六)弭麼攞[寧*吉]麼攞(十七)播哩秫馱(十八)鉢(二合)頭帽播立跢(十九)惹攞麼爛弭秫馱(二十)輸(去)馱野輸(去)馱野(二十一)播囉麼摩訶秫陀(上)薩埵(二十二)[合*牛][怡-台+巿]那謨塞(同上)窒(二合)[口*履]步縛泥(二十三)[合*牛][怡-台+巿]莎(二合)縛訶(二十四)是真言以奮怒王神變光明。
translation: 唵旖暮伽(上一)訥(二合)嚕莽攞嚲(二)弭理乞灑舍佉(三)鉢怛(二合)囉補澁簸叵攞(四)弭吒播嚕[可*欠]娜儞跢誐拏(五)補澁波迦哩搖(尼照反)縒(六)囉娜遜娜囉(七)跛(二合同上)囉塞(二合同上)囉縛拏(八)弭弭馱弭質怛(二合)囉(九)播哩輸(去)陀(上)野(十)鉢(二合)頭麼步惹(十一)娑(去)麼娑(去)麼(十二)三(去)曼諦娜(十三)播哩曼拏攞(十四)播哩輸(去)馱野(十五)摩攞麼攞(十六)弭麼攞[寧*吉]麼攞(十七)播哩秫馱(十八)鉢(二合)頭帽播立跢(十九)惹攞麼爛弭秫馱(二十)輸(去)馱野輸(去)馱野(二十一)播囉麼摩訶秫陀(上)薩埵(二十二)[合*牛][怡-台+巿]那謨塞(同上)窒(二合)[口*履]步縛泥(二十三)[合*牛][怡-台+巿]莎(二合)縛訶(二十四)是真言以奮怒王神變光明。

source_sentence: 加持白栴檀香水白芥子。
translation: It's a blessing of white sandalwood scented water and white mustard seed.
It scatters the water from rivers and springs, and the water from wells.
It's fruit-bearing trees, flowers, seedlings, crops, and medicinal plants.
If any sentient being touches it, drinks it, or devours it, then that's good for you.
Or even bathe them.
They'll all be freed from all the hindrances of sins.
They'll be born in the heavens or in a pure land.
They'll realize the concentration of immeasurable wisdom and understanding.
If he were to repeatedly apply pressure and enter, he'd bathe in it.
His body is divided into three equal parts.

source_sentence: 一沒至項二沒至臍三沒至膝。
translation: One is bent up to the neck, two is bent up to the navel, and three is bent up to the knees.
He prepares a bath of recitation for the upper, middle, and lower portions of his body.

source_sentence: 蠲諸罪垢一切道智證集成就。
translation: It will remove the stain of sins and the realization of the wisdom of all paths.
True words for bathing

source_sentence: 唵旖暮祇(虬曳反一)旖麼[口*(隸-木+匕)]弭麼[口*(隸-木+匕)][寧*吉](寧吉反)麼[口*(隸-木+匕)](二)[寧*吉](寧立反)[名*也](名也反)鉢唎秫第(三)薩縛麼羅播迦[口*栗]使羝(四)摩訶菩地薩埵婆(同上)囉泥(五)縛囉跛(二合同上)囉縛囉播哩秫第(六)摩訶麼抳囉怛娜迦野播哩秫第(七)麼抳麼抳(八)輸(去)馱儞(九)摩訶暮伽(上)振跢麼抳秫第(十)紇唎娜野秫第(十一)迦野[寧*吉]麼攞(十二)摩訶麼抳鉢唎秫第(十三)虎嚕虎嚕(十四)跛(二合)囉縛囉播抳(十五)摩訶步惹婆(同上)囉泥(十六)覩嚕覩嚕(十七)摩訶薩埵襪娑(去)[口*(隸-木+匕)](十八)播哩輸(去)馱野(十九)麼麼播般(北曼反)素弭秫馱麼[口*(隸-木+士)](二十)莎(二合)縛訶(二十一)是真言以奮怒王神變光明。
translation: 唵旖暮祇(虬曳反一)旖麼[口*(隸-木+匕)]弭麼[口*(隸-木+匕)][寧*吉](寧吉反)麼[口*(隸-木+匕)](二)[寧*吉](寧立反)[名*也](名也反)鉢唎秫第(三)薩縛麼羅播迦[口*栗]使羝(四)摩訶菩地薩埵婆(同上)囉泥(五)縛囉跛(二合同上)囉縛囉播哩秫第(六)摩訶麼抳囉怛娜迦野播哩秫第(七)麼抳麼抳(八)輸(去)馱儞(九)摩訶暮伽(上)振跢麼抳秫第(十)紇唎娜野秫第(十一)迦野[寧*吉]麼攞(十二)摩訶麼抳鉢唎秫第(十三)虎嚕虎嚕(十四)跛(二合)囉縛囉播抳(十五)摩訶步惹婆(同上)囉泥(十六)覩嚕覩嚕(十七)摩訶薩埵襪娑(去)[口*(隸-木+匕)](十八)播哩輸(去)馱野(十九)麼麼播般(北曼反)素弭秫馱麼[口*(隸-木+士)](二十)莎(二合)縛訶(二十一)是真言以奮怒王神變光明。

source_sentence: 加持白栴檀香欝金香龍腦香湯。
translation: It's a blessing of white sandalwood and gold, and it's a scented potion of dragon's brains.
It's also the true saying of the King of Agitation.
"He consecrates his head with fragrant baths, drinks it, and rinses it.
He washes his body and decorates his clothes with pure water.
He adds another sprinkle of pure water and sets his seal to protect it.
He contemplates a multitude of sages offering three handfuls of water.
It's to purify body and mind and liberate sentient beings.
They venerate the noble one and rid him of the three poisons.
He observes that he's purifying body and soul and going into a fine room.
Then he'll be freed from all the defiling hindrances.

source_sentence: 一切毘那夜迦藥叉羅剎諸惡鬼神而不嬈亂。
translation: All the Vaiḍraka, Yakṣa, and Rāṣṭrapāla spirits and evil demons won't be disturbed.
They'll also be able to work, sleep, dream, and be at ease.

source_sentence: 諸佛菩薩諸天天神觀視擁護。
translation: The buddhas, bodhisattvas, and heavenly spirits will watch and protect them.

source_sentence: 當命終後安樂國土蓮臺受生。
translation: After his life ends, he'll be reborn in the lotus dais of his paradise land.

source_sentence: 識宿命智乃至菩提而不退轉。
translation: They'll know their past lives and attain enlightenment without turning back.'
Biaojie zhenyan

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)鉢(二合)頭麼弭麼[口*(隸-木+士)](二)跛(同上二合)囉娑(去)囉(三)三(去)漫嚲目谿(四)莎(二合)縛訶(五)是真言以奮怒王威德神變。
translation: Om yamogha (supra) i) po (dichotomy) dumo moe moe [mou * (clan - mu + sh)] (ii) lame (ditto) rasa (depart) rasa (iii) sa (depart) manchak (iv) svāh (v) This is a true teaching that uses the King of Agitation's authoritative power and miraculous transformation.
It's a five-colored cord that's supported by a miraculous power of the king of fury.
It's used to measure the altar perimeter.
It's a colorful true saying.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上)弭弭陀(上一)弭只怛(二合)囉散陀(上)囉(二)參(去)皤囉(三)鉢(二合)囉縛囉步臡(同上四)莎(二合)縛訶(五)是真言以奮怒王神變光明。
translation: Om yamogha (supra) vimrodha (supra. 1) vetu (2) rasta (supra) rāja (2) sen (depart) para (3) prabhū (2) rāvu (3) prabhū (2) rāja (4) svāh (5) This is a true teaching that uses the miraculous radiance of the king of fury.
It's a colorful perfume and scented gelatin that's applied.

source_sentence: 圖畫一切諸佛菩薩一切天神一切印相山花水獸。
translation: It pictures all the buddhas, bodhisattvas, gods, seals, flowers, mountains, rivers, and animals.
Jeweled Earth True Words

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)三(去)曼嚲(二)播哩曼拏攞(三)播捨襪第(四)[合*牛](五)是真言以奮怒王神變光明。
translation: Om (supra) three (departing) maṇḍalas (two) pāri maṇḍalas (three) poṣadī (four) [ha*niu] (five) This is the true teaching that uses the miraculous radiance of the king of wrath to scatter the altar realm.
It's a white mustard seed that's scattered over the altar and seats.
It creates a jeweled staircase.
This is the true saying for the boundary.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)弭弭馱嚕跛弭(二)只怛(二合)囉娜捨匿(寧即反三)摩訶枲[牟*含]滿馱野(四)度嚕度嚕(五)[合*牛][怡-台+巿]莎(二合)縛訶(六)是真言以奮怒王威德神變。
translation: Om Yamogha (supra): (1) Mimiruddha (2) Jeta (2) Rāhana (3) Śanaiścara (3) Mahāmucilinda (4) Tuolumu (5) [Jītaka*Niu] [Jītaka+City] Vākha (6) This is a true teaching that uses the King of Anger's authoritative power and miraculous transformation.
He blesses it with the perfume of a white mustard seed.
It's scattered over the altar and banners, forming the Vajra City.
This is a true chant for protecting the body.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)[口*落]訖灑抳(二)播捨[可*欠]塞(同上)羝(三)覩嚕覩嚕(四)莎(二合)縛訶(五)是真言以奮怒王威德神變。
translation: Om Yamogha (supra)[m*lo] kisha抳 (b) Pāśa [ko*o] sā (ibid.) ram (c) Tuolu Tuolu (d) svāh (d) svāh (e) This is a true teaching that uses the mighty and miraculous power of the king of rage to apply perfume from a white mustard seed.
It's applied with a sprinkling of white mustard-seed perfume.
He sprinkles it on his body to protect it.
This is the true saying for the hairdo.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)注拏摩抳(二)虎嚕虎嚕(三)那(奴箇反)誐播捨畔第(四)[合*牛]莎(二合)縛訶(五)是真言以奮怒王威德神變。
translation: Om yamogha (above), svāna-mātṛ (2) hulu-hulu (3) nagara-gappanshabandi (4) [hap*niu] svāhā (2) (5) This is a true teaching that uses the mighty and miraculous power of the king of rage to apply to the hair and comb the topknot.
It's a blessing for fixing the hair on the topknot of Vatsa's head.
This is a true chant for protecting his disciples.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)[口*珞]訖灑三(去)曼底娜(二)摩訶播勢(三)步嚕步嚕(四)莎(二合)縛訶(五)是真言以奮怒王神變光明。
translation: Om yamogha (top one) [mouth*lo] kisasan (go) mantina (two) mahāpāsa (three) pulu pulu (four) svāhā (two) vāha (five) This is a true teaching that uses the miraculous radiance of the king of fury.
It's a blessing of white mustard-seed ash.

source_sentence: 弟子同伴給侍之人點佩護身。
translation: A companion of the disciple gives it to someone in his service to wear as protection.
This is a true chant for purifying the hands.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)惹攞弭麼隷(二)素嚕素嚕莎(二合三)縛訶(四)是真言以奮怒王神變光明。
translation: Om Yamogha (supra. 1) Jalāmagupta (2) Suru Suruṣa (2. 3) Vāha (4) This true teaching uses the miraculous radiance of the king of fury to wash his hands [swimming-yong+cut] with pure water.

source_sentence: 加持淨水洗手[泳-永+截]身。
translation: He blesses his body with pure water and washes his hands [swimming-yong+cutting].
This is a true chant for purifying the mouth and face.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)旖弭[口*栗]跢泯努(二)者囉者囉(三)莎(二合)縛訶(四)是真言以奮怒王神變光明。
translation: Om yamuga (supra) yamui[ku*li]kuṇḍanu (b) yerā yerā (c) svāhā (d) This is a true teaching that uses the transformative power of the king of wrath to shine brightly.
It's a blessing of pure water that washes his hands and face.
It cleans his mouth and teeth.
He dots his eyes and ears and shoulders.
He recites it as a ritual.
This is a true chant for healing robes.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)[寧*立][名*也]縛塞(同上)窒(二合)[口*(隸-木+士)](二)主嚕主嚕(三)莎(二合)縛訶(四)是真言以奮怒王神變光明。
translation: Om yangmuga (supra)[ning*li][nam*ya]vasai (ibid.) choke (dichotomy) [mouth*(clan-wood+shi)] (b) Śrāvastī (c) svāhā (dichotomy) (d) This is a true teaching that uses the miraculous radiance of the king of fury.
It blesses his robe and carries it in accordance with the rules.
This is a true chant for wearing armor.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)步穰(上)誐迦縛者(二)縛囉泥(三)旨[口*履]旨[口*履](四)莎(二合)縛訶(五)是真言以奮怒王神變光明。
translation: Om (supra) puyang (supra) gaṅgāvāsana (ii) vārāṇasana (iii) gi [mout * cu] gi [mout * cu] (iv) svāhā (dichotomy) (v) This is a true teaching that uses the miraculous radiance of the king of fury.
It's applied to the perfumed white mustard seed of Ujjayin.
[YONG-YONG+CUT] sprinkles it on his body to wrap up his armor.
This is a true chant for being snared.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)沒(二合)囉[可*欠]麼步臡(二)播[口*履]演羝娜(三)跛(同上二合)囉娑(去)囉(四)莎(二合)縛訶(五)是真言以奮怒王神變光明。
translation: Om muṅga (supra. I) mo [ko * yo] lo [ko * yo] ma po po (II) po [ko * yo] yan bhoga (III) lame (ibid.) lo sa (go) lo (IV) svāh (II) vāha (V) This is a true teaching that uses the transformative power of the wrathful king's radiance.
It's a knot made of five-colored threads that he binds.
He holds it in his hand and carries it in his hand.
This is the true invocation for consecration.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)注拏麼抳(二)鉢頭米旖避詵者(引)野(三)麼麼薩縛嚲詑誐跢(四)鼻曬階(五)麼抳麼抳(六)莎(二合)縛訶(七)是真言以奮怒王神變光明。
translation: Om yamogha(1) svāna māyān (2) padmavatsa(2) svāhā (3) mamosavatagem (4) bījāta (5) māyān māyān (6) svāhā (7) This is a true teaching that uses the miraculous radiance of the king of fury.
It's a blessing in the form of a perfume of the blazing blaze.
It's a consecration that brings support.
This is the true chant of the throne.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)鉢(二合)頭麼遜娜隷(二)駄囉馱囉抳(三)漫拏隷[合*牛](四)是真言以奮怒王神變光明。
translation: Om yamogha (1) pa (2) dharmasena (2) dharma-rāja (3) maṇḍala (4) This is a true teaching that uses the miraculous radiance of the king of fury.
It's a blessing to sit in the appropriate position on the spot where he's seated.
True Saying for Sleeping

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)三(去)曼諦(二)播[口*履]養(去)鷄(三)步縛娜(四)莎(二合)縛訶(五)是真言以奮怒王神變光明。
translation: Om yamogha (supra) samyak-sa (departed) maṇḍi (b) pārājika (departed) kiṃśuka (c) buvana (d) svāhā (dichotomy) vāha (e) This is a true teaching that uses the miraculous radiance of the king of fury.
It's a blessing to spread out a bed and make it suitable for sleeping.
It's a true chant for holding flowers.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)素囉避補澁批(二)播囉播囉(三)[合*牛](四)是真言加持香花。
translation: Om Yamogha(1) Suraprabhāsa(2) Pārāpāla(3) [Hop*Niu](4) This is the true teaching to bless with fragrant flowers.

source_sentence: 以不空王種種香花海雲。
translation: It's a sea cloud of various fragrant flowers from the king of nonemptyness.
Prabhūta makes offerings.
This is a true saying for incense at the end of the day.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)弭弭馱巘(魚蹇反)馱(二)跛(同上二合)囉娑(去)[口*(隸-木+士)]補嚕(三)補刺拏步臡(四)莎(二合)縛訶(五)是真言加持末香。
translation: (1) Om kamogha (1) moi moi dhātu (2) lame (as above) lo sar (depart) [kowl*(lid-wood+s)] pulu (3) puṣpa nabu sapu (4) sar (2) vāha (5) this is the true saying to invoke the end of incense.

source_sentence: 以不空王種種末香海雲。
translation: It's a sea cloud of the various fragrances of the king of nonemptying.
Pu offerings.
This is a true invocation for coating the body with incense.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)弭弭陀(上)禮跛娜(二)鉢(二合)囉縛[口*(隸-木+匕)](三)比哩比哩(四)莎(二合)縛訶(五)是真言加持塗香。
translation: Om kamogha (above) i) vimukha (above) salutation (ii) prabhāsa (b) raurava [mouth*(cl-wood+dagger)] (iii) pṛthivī (iv) svāhā (b) vāha (v) This is the true teaching to apply incense.

source_sentence: 以不空王種種塗香海雲。
translation: It's a sea cloud of various fragrance applied by the king of nonemptyness.
They coat the altar and make offerings to Puṇḍarī.
He burns the incense with this true saying.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)誐誐娜(二)塞(桑乙反二合)叵囉拏米伽(上三)度嚕度嚕(四)[合*牛](五)是真言加持燒香。

source_sentence: 加持歡喜團麨蘆菔三白食香花香水。

It causes joy and doesn't create obstructions.

source_sentence: 出世解脫壇印品第二十八
translation: Chapter Twenty-Eight of the Platform Seal of Worldly Liberation

source_sentence: 世尊是出世解脫壇印三昧耶。
translation: "The Bhagavān is the supramundane liberation altar-mudrā.

source_sentence: 能會一切種族解脫壇印三昧耶。
translation: He's a samādhi that understands the altar-mudrā of liberation for all races.

source_sentence: 當證出世無上三摩地加持壇印。
translation: He will then realize the supreme supreme altar seal of meditative equipoise that transcends the world.
He joins his wrists and puts them together.
He takes his two thumbs and two pinkies.
Bend them into your palms.
Bending their heads flat, they lean on each other and come together.
Bend each of the two middle fingers like a hook.
Their heads are separated by one inch.

source_sentence: 二頭指二無名指竪微屈之。
translation: The two head fingers and two ring fingers stand up and are slightly flexed.
The heads of the two digits are separated by two inches.

source_sentence: 二無名指頭相去寸半印真言。
translation: The heads of the two ring fingers are separated by an inch and a half, and he signs the mantra.

source_sentence: 唵鉢(二合)頭麼步臡(一)鉢(二合)頭麼迦[口*(隸-木+匕)](二)鉢(二合)頭麼弭麼隷(三)莎(二合)縛訶(四)加持解脫印合掌虛掌。
translation: "Om pa (sextuple) dum [mou*(l-wood+dagger)] (2) pa (sextuple) dum [mou*(l-wood+dagger)] (2) pa (sextuple) dum [mou*(l-wood+dagger)] (3) svāh (sextuple) vāha (4) the seal of blessing and liberation, with palms together and open palms.

source_sentence: 二頭指二無名指二小指。
translation: He connects his two forefingers, two ring fingers, and two little fingers.
They are extended and slightly flexed, and they touch their heads together.
The two thumbs stand up and touch each other.
He bends his two middle fingers up to their knuckles.
They're separated by half an inch from each other at the head.
The ten fingers are separated from each other by three parts.

source_sentence: 此印三昧乃是一切菩薩摩訶薩所敬禮處。
translation: This seal of meditation is a place where all bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and venerables worship.
If he always holds the knot in respect and observes it, then he'll always observe Avalokitêśvara as the bodhisattva.
Then he'll always observe Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 當令決定得證無上正等菩提。
translation: He will surely realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
He seals the mantra.

source_sentence: 唵鉢(二合)頭米(一)素(蘇古反)鉢(二合)頭米(二)弭目訖灑(三)漫拏攞(四)鉢(二合)頭麼步臡(五)[合*牛]莎(二合)縛訶(六)如來解脫印合掌虛掌。
translation: "Om prabhūtaratna (1) sukhu prabhūtaratna (2) mimukhāsa (3) mannala (4) prabhūtaratna (5) [h*niu] svāhā (2) vāha (6) the sign of the Tathāgata's liberation, which is made by closing the palms and holding the hands open.

source_sentence: 以二中指捻二無名指背上節。
translation: He takes his two middle fingers and twists the dorsal and upper knuckles of his two ring fingers.

source_sentence: 二頭指二無名指二小指合頭相著。
translation: He puts his two index fingers, two ring fingers, and two pinkies together at the top of his head.
He puts his two thumbs erect and touching each other.

source_sentence: 此印三昧能示真實解脫三昧。
translation: This seal of meditation demonstrates the true samādhi of liberation.
True Sayings of the Seal for Understanding the Karmic Hindrances

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)跋馹囉(二)鉢(二合)頭麼步臡(三)弭理弭理(四)莎(二合)縛訶(五)如意寶印合掌以二無名指二小指。

He bends them into his palm and presses them to the right and crosses them to the left.
He puts his right thumb in his palm and pins it to the left.
He puts his two middle fingers up and slightly bends his head to touch them.

source_sentence: 二頭指押二中指側中節上。
translation: He puts his two index fingers on the middle knuckle of his two middle fingers at the side.
They rest their heads on each other.
This is the seal of samādhi for making various offerings.

source_sentence: 當獲不空圓滿六波羅蜜業。
translation: He'll attain the six perfections of nonempty karma.

source_sentence: 不空示現一切諸佛菩薩神通解脫曼拏羅業。
translation: He'll manifest all the buddhas and bodhisattvas' karmic abilities and liberating maṇḍalas.
Amoghasiddhi purifies the five kinds of unremitting karma.
He seals the invocation with the following dhāraṇī.

translation: Om yamogha (top one) mahāmama (bottom two) mahāmama (bottom three) pātra (bottom two) mahāmama (bottom four) sahā (bottom two) vāha (bottom five) lotus flower hook sign, fold your wrists together and open your palms.
He bends his two middle fingers like hooks.

source_sentence: 二大拇指二頭指二無名指二小指竪微屈之。
translation: The two thumbs, two fingers, two ring fingers, and two pinkies are flexed slightly.
The heads of the ten fingers are separated by an inch and a half.

source_sentence: 此印三昧能證一切如來無上正等菩提。
translation: This seal of meditation can realize the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of all tathāgatas.

source_sentence: 出世解脫三摩地印真言。
translation: The seal of supramundane liberation, Samādhi, is a true saying.

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上一)跋馹隷(二)摩訶鉢(二合)頭米(三)惹理素惹理(四)摩訶惹理(五)莎(二合)縛訶(六)金剛蓮華鉤印合腕相著開掌。
translation: "Om kamogha (top one) bhadraka (bottom two) mahāpatti (bottom two) dharma (bottom three) jāri sojāri (bottom four) mahājāri (bottom five) svāhā (bottom two) vāha (bottom six) vajra lotus hook sign with wrists pressed together and palms open.
He bends his two middle fingers slightly and rests them against each other.
He bends his two middle fingers together.
He puts his two middle fingers on the side of his middle knuckle.
It's like a hook.

source_sentence: 二大拇指二無名指二小指竪微屈之。
translation: The two thumbs, two ring fingers, and two pinkies extend and slightly bend them.

source_sentence: 二大拇指二無名指二小指。
translation: The two thumbs, two ring fingers, and two pinkies are slightly flexed.
They should be separated from each other by an inch and a half at the tip.
This is the seal of samādhi for making offerings.

source_sentence: 能證一切如來無上正等菩提神通威德。
translation: He'll be able to realize the supernormal powers and authority of the unsurpassed correct enlightenment of all tathāgatas.
True Sayings of the Samādhi Mudrā

source_sentence: 唵旖暮伽(上)悉第(一)薩縛嚲詑誐跢悉第(二)旖縛路枳嚲悉第(三)矩嚕矩嚕(四)莎(二合)縛訶(五)頂禮印合掌虛掌。
translation: Om yamogha (above) siddhi (1) svātakajama siddhi (2) kuṇḍu kuṇḍu siddhi (3) kuṇḍu (4) svāhā (2) (5) bowing his head with his palms together and open his hands.
He spreads his two thumbs and two pinkies apart.
Their heads are separated by an inch and a half.
The two middle fingers stand up and are slightly flexed.
Their heads are separated by six parts.
He raises the tips of his two middle fingers.
The heads of the bottom two ring fingers are separated by six inches.
The tips of the two index fingers are three parts apart.
He points his two middle fingers and his two ring fingers.
They touch each other with their heads up.
The head finger, middle finger, and ring finger.
They shouldn't touch each other between the fingers.

source_sentence: 此印三昧能得證見觀世音清淨身一切三摩地不退無上正等菩提。
translation: This seal of meditation enables him to realize the clear body of Avalokitêśvara, all the samādhis, and unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
The true words of the samādhi mudrā are.

source_sentence: 唵旖縛路枳嚲(一)摩訶秫(輸律反)陀(上)薩埵(二)縒囉縒囉(三)三(去)漫嚲縛皤縒(四)軍(去)拏攞陀(上)囉(五)旖弭嚲皤摩矩吒陀(上)囉(六)惹吒麼矩吒(七)那縛戰捺(二合)囉漫抳嚲(八)者囉者囉(九)散者囉(十)步縛泥濕縛囉(十一)鉢(二合)頭麼步惹(十二)莎(二合)縛訶(十三)世尊是七大印。
translation: "Om vajra kiṃśuka (a) mahāprajñātaka (supreme) sattva (b) śarabgata (c) śarabgata (d) kuṇḍala (supreme) rāja (e) mahākūṭa (supreme) rāja (f) jātamakūṭa (g) nāvajña (dichotomy) rāja (h) rāja (i) rāja (ix) rāja (x) puṇḍala (k) puṇḍala (xi) puṇḍala (dichotomy) rāja (xii) svāh (xiii) svāh (xiii) svāh (xiii) are the seven great signs of the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 能轉示現觀世音宮殿轉法輪會。
translation: They can transform and manifest the Dharma-wheel turning assembly at Avalokitêśvara's palace.
These seals and so forth are each one koṭī.
They are surrounded by servants in front and behind the great seals.

source_sentence: 若有有情淨浴香塗治潔衣服。
translation: "If there are sentient beings, they are cleansed with a bath of incense and clean clothes.
Three times a day, they'll be in front of Avalokitêśvara.
Or in front of the Buddha or in front of the Śāriputra.
They are offered flowers, scents, food, and offerings as they like.
He arouses his mind with great compassion for all sentient beings.
He invites all the buddhas of the ten directions.
Sending down a great dharma rain to benefit sentient beings.
He goes to the undefiled place and abides in the Dharma body.
He observes himself as the characteristic of the Dharma realm.
Their own nature is equal.
It's pure in nature and Dharma nature.
Its amount is the same as the pure space of the Dharma realm.
He observes and is mindful of my body.

source_sentence: 白栴檀香沈水香龍腦香。
translation: It's the scent of white sandalwood, the scent of sinking water, and the scent of dragon head.
Rubbing it on my palms, I form this kind of seal and so forth.

source_sentence: 每日鐺結七俱胝印三昧耶若印印身。
translation: Each day, he makes a seven-corpus Christi seal, a samaya, or a sign on his body.
That will prevent him from denigrating the true teaching and destroying it.
He disparages the noble ones.
Those are the five unremitting sins.

source_sentence: 又鐺種種承事供養九十二殑伽沙俱胝那庾多百千如來。
translation: They also make various offerings to the ninety-two sagas and kuṭīnaya tathāgatas.
They're a heap of good roots and merit.
They're perfectly matched with the six perfections.
They'll then be able to abide in the stage of nonretrogression.

source_sentence: 復為一切諸佛菩薩摩訶薩攝受護持。
translation: They'll also be taken in and protected by all the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and mahāsattvas.

source_sentence: 一切天龍藥叉羅剎乾闥婆阿素洛蘖魯荼緊那羅摩呼羅伽皆擁護之。
translation: All the gods, dragons, yakṣas, rājas, gandharvas, asuras, tillas, rudras, kiṃnaras, and mahoragas all support them.

source_sentence: 伊首羅天摩醯首羅天四天王天焰摩王水天俱廢羅天俱摩羅天皆擁護之。
translation: The god Īśvara, the god Mahêśvara, the four heavenly kings, the god Yama, the god Kauśālêndra, and the god Kauśālêndra are all there to protect him.

source_sentence: 當得如來金剛舍利達摩之身。
translation: They will then attain the Tathāgata's adamantine body of Śāriputrāma.

source_sentence: 不為世間毒藥毒蟲水火刀杖種種災害。
translation: He won't be harmed by the poisonous insects, water, fire, swords, or knives of the world.

source_sentence: 常得夢見諸佛菩薩觀世音菩薩。
translation: He'll always see the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and Avalokitêśvara bodhisattvas in dreams.
They'll be filled with good auspiciousness.
Noble people respect and remember him.

source_sentence: 三十三天一切諸仙恭敬恃怙。
translation: All the sages of the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven respect and rely on him.

source_sentence: 出世相應解脫品第二十九
translation: Chapter 29 of the Chapter on Liberation Associated with Transcendence

source_sentence: 世尊是出世瑜伽解脫最上神通蓮花曼拏羅三昧耶。
translation: "The Bhagavān is the lotus-flower maṇḍala samaya, the supreme superknowledge of liberation from the yoga that transcends the world.

source_sentence: 能現沙門婆羅門國王王子后妃婇女大臣僚佐童男童女一切人民。
translation: It's able to manifest the princes, queens, women, ministers, assistants, boys, girls, and all the people of the ascetic Brahman kingdom.

source_sentence: 過現未來出世法生滅法。
translation: past, present, future, and transmundane dharmas, birth and extinction dharmas, and bad effects dharmas.
The law of good retribution and the law of bad retribution.
The marks of wealth and prosperity, the marks of poverty, and lowliness.
The characteristic of long and short life and the characteristic of the wheel of birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 復現大梵天帝釋天那羅延天摩醯首羅天。
translation: They also appear as the gods Brahmā, Indra, Nārāyaṇa, Mahêśvara, and Mahêśvara.

source_sentence: 乃至一切天龍藥叉羅剎乾闥婆阿素洛蘖魯荼緊那羅摩呼羅伽等相。
translation: They also show the characteristics of all the gods, dragons, yakṣas, lhasa, gandharvas, asuras, tulips, lhūtas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, and so forth.

source_sentence: 餓鬼相阿毘地獄種種諸相。
translation: The marks of hungry ghosts, the marks of abhidharma, and all the various marks of hell.
There's the picture of famine in the land, the picture of fertility, and the picture of calamity and misfortune.
There are the signs of famine, the signs of epidemics, and the signs of calamity.
The four seasonal signs of wind and rain, both timely and not timely.

source_sentence: 持此法者如教實語發大悲心。
translation: Those who uphold this teaching speak truly as it's taught and give rise to the mind of great compassion.

source_sentence: 依據一切諸佛菩薩摩訶薩住。
translation: Relying on all the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and mahāsattvas, he abides.
It benefits an inexhaustible number of sentient beings.
His mind is constantly unwavering in the vow for omniscience.

source_sentence: 必令救度潔治身服守持淨戒。
translation: He must cause salvation, cleanse his body, dress himself, and observe the pure precepts.

source_sentence: 不於一切有戒無戒人生傲慢。
translation: He doesn't become arrogant in regard to all beings who have or don't have the precepts.
He conducts his mind equally and cultivates it according to the teaching.
Then he'll achieve it.
He makes a silver lotus flower that's pure and according to the teaching.
He takes a mirror at one elbow and makes it the face of the lotus stand.
It's adorned by four rafters adorned with jewels and flower garlands.

source_sentence: 如法銀造一尺二寸不空羂索觀世音菩薩。
translation: The Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva is a one-foot-two-inch unerring kettle made of silver according to the teaching.
His one-faced, three-eyed body has four arms.

source_sentence: 一手執三叉戟一手持羂索。
translation: In one hand, he holds a trident, and in the other, he holds a noose.

source_sentence: 一手執蓮花一手掌如意寶珠。
translation: In one hand, he holds a lotus flower, and in the other, he holds a wish-granting jewel.
He's sitting cross-legged.
He wears a jeweled crown on his head and is crowned with a transformation buddha.

source_sentence: 像腹內空舍利百粒龍腦香白栴檀香安內腹中。
translation: Inside the image's belly are a hundred empty relics, fragrance from dragon brains and white sandalwood, which are placed inside the belly.
He's crowned with flowers, bejeweled with earrings and a ring.
The gods are adorned in various ways with robes.
He places it on top of a mirror and mind.
He smeared the ground with pure clay and made a maṇḍala.
It's five cubits wide and circular, with four openings and four gates.

source_sentence: 內院中畫八葉七寶開敷蓮華。
translation: In the inner courtyard, he paints a lotus with eight leaves and seven jewels in bloom.

source_sentence: 其花葉上多羅菩薩濕廢多菩薩。
translation: On top of the flowering leaves is the bodhisattva Tārā, Śirhānta.

source_sentence: 執金剛祕密主菩薩毘俱胝菩薩。
translation: Vairocana, the bodhisattva who holds the vajra and mystic lords, and Vairocana, the bodhisattva who holds the lotus.

source_sentence: 蓮花遜那利菩薩無垢慧菩薩。
translation: Padmasaṃnara Bodhisattva, the Lotus Flower Sonnarī Bodhisattva, and Vimalakīrti Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 除八難觀世音菩薩悉地王菩薩。
translation: Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva Who Removes the Eight Difficulties Bodhisattva Siddhi King Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 外院東門右大梵天帝釋天。
translation: Outside the east gate of the courtyard, to the right is the Mahābrahma Heaven, the Tissa Heaven.

source_sentence: 左伊首羅天摩醯首羅天。
translation: To the left, there's the Īśvara Heaven and the Mahêśvara Heaven.

source_sentence: 南門右俱摩羅天俱廢羅天。
translation: At the south entrance, he's on the right in the Kumaṇḍa Heaven and on the left in the Kauśāla Heaven.
On the left, he's a god of the Earth gods of the Yama Heaven.

source_sentence: 北門右那羅延天大自在天。
translation: At the north gate, he's right of the Nārāyaṇa Heaven and left of the Mahêśvara Heaven.

source_sentence: 左毘摩夜天女阿努梵摩天女。
translation: He's the left Vimalayan goddess, the Anubhāna goddess.

source_sentence: 西門右婆魯拏天女婆散底天女。
translation: At the western entrance, he's the Varuṇa goddess on his right, the Vātsīputrīya goddess on his left.

source_sentence: 左一髻羅剎女金剛度底使者。
translation: On the left, there's the female Ikṣvāku Rāṣṭrapāla, a Vajradhātuṇī messenger.
At the east entrance, there's the goddess Shang-i-nir.
The south gate is the goddess Pūrṇa and the south gate is the goddess Pūrṇandi.
The western approach is the goddess of merit.
The northern approach is the Sarasvatī goddess of eloquence.
There are four heavenly kings in four dimensions.
There's the lotus-flower garland in the inner court.
In the outer courtyard is the garland of the three-pronged vajra.
In the center is Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva in silver.
He faces east.
Various banners and flowers are placed in an ornament.
A five-colored string rope surrounds the outer court.
It's decorated with the three white foods and drinks of the perfumed water of the guardian beings.
There are various foods, fruits, fruits, and fragrant stūpas.
Lots of wonderful flower garlands are arranged according to the rules.

source_sentence: 白旃檀香沈水香蘇合香龍腦香。
translation: White sandalwood incense, sinking-water incense, sumac, and lobelia incense are placed around it.
Stone and honey are combined to purify it, burn it, and make offerings.
They then cleanse themselves, bathe themselves, and rub themselves with incense.
He wears pure clothing and eats the three white foods.
He guards the six hours of the day and night according to the law.
Resolute and undaunted, he observes his body as an image.
He has the appearance of a maṇḍala, and his features are dignified.
He restrains his six faculties with internal joy and feeling.
They are serene, pure, and white.

source_sentence: 五輪投地至誠敬禮十方剎土三世一切諸佛如來。
translation: Throwing his five wheels to the ground, he sincerely venerates all the buddha-tathāgatas of the three times in the buddha-lands of the ten directions.

source_sentence: 大乘教藏一切曼拏羅印三昧耶。
translation: He said, "Great vehicle teaching treasury, all maṇḍala mudrās.
He invited them to sit cross-legged at the invitation of the buddhas.
He arouses the mind of enlightenment and observes the five aggregates and realms.
'The nature of what's attached to and what's attached to is unconstructed.'
Their own bodies are empty and tranquil.
He wavers with his face and eyes to the west, and his eyelids are agitated.
He gazes at Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva.
The sound image is spies and sharpens his eyes.

source_sentence: 誦奮怒王真言母陀羅尼真言。
translation: He recites the true words of the king of agitation, the mother of all dhāraṇīs, and the true words of the dhāraṇī for the mother of agitation.

source_sentence: 溥遍心印真言不思議觀陀羅尼真言。
translation: He recites the Pūrvavideha dhāraṇī, the seal of the pervasive mind, the dhāraṇī of inconceivable contemplation, and the dhāraṇī of the siddhi king.
"This is the true saying of the Siddhi King.

source_sentence: 光明加持銀蓮花觀世音菩薩。
translation: Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva, the silver lotus flower that's brightly endowed.

source_sentence: 時別自以奮怒王真言奮怒王印。
translation: He then applied the seal of the wrathful king with the true words of the wrathful king.
He consecrates and blesses it.
"If a light shines from the mirror of a lotus flower, then the Avalokitêśvara figure's body emits nectar-like water.
The Avalokitêśvara goddess of merit's body emits nectar-like water.
He emits a variety of lights, and then he himself emits a light.

source_sentence: 則當獲得不空無垢清淨蘊身。
translation: Then he'll attain the body of the pure aggregate of nonemptyness and immaculateness.
The Amoghasiddhi-samaya of the nonempty king's mind will be accomplished.

source_sentence: 是時緊捷誦奮怒王真言。
translation: At that point, he recites the verbal chant, "King of Agitation!

source_sentence: 觀世音菩薩鏡中出現讚言。
translation: Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva appeared in the mirror and praised him, saying.
"Good, good!

source_sentence: 汝今成就出世世間鏡壇印法。
translation: Now, you've accomplished the ritual of sealing the mirror altar of the transmundane world.
What vow do you need to fulfill for yourself?
It's to make offerings to Guṇabharman and to ask for whatever you wish.
They'll all be fulfilled.'

source_sentence: 沙門婆羅門國王王子后妃婇女大臣僚佐一切人民。
translation: The king of the ascetic Brahman kingdom, his princes, consorts, women, ministers, and servants, and all of his people.
Those who look at the image in the mirror will see the various miraculous powers and transformations.
They all see the various miraculous powers and transfigurations.

source_sentence: 亦見自身過現未來種種業果善惡之相。
translation: They also see themselves in the past, present, and future, with the results of various actions, good and bad appearances.

source_sentence: 及見一切剎土諸佛補陀洛山觀世音宮中大眾。
translation: He also sees the multitude of people in the Avalokitêśvara palace on Mount Potala in all the buddhas of the land.

source_sentence: 亦見世間一切時節善不善相。
translation: They also see the good and unwholesome aspects of the world at all times.
They only remove jealousy, flattery, doubt, and pride.
He violates precepts, holds wrong views, and steals samaya.

source_sentence: 旃荼羅苾芻苾芻尼鄔波索迦鄔波斯迦及諸外道惡律人民。
translation: The caṇḍāla bhikṣu, the bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikā, and the people of non-Buddhist bad laws.
The rest of them see it.

source_sentence: 觀世音菩薩示語讚歎與滅一切垢障重罪。
translation: Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva showed, spoke, praised, and extinguished all the stains, hindrances, and heavy crimes.
This is a statement of concentration that's not false.
Those who practice this teaching should spend six hours of the day and night.

source_sentence: 特勿懈怠放逸慵惰則速成就。
translation: Don't be lazy, careless, or indolent, and you'll quickly achieve it.

source_sentence: 不空羂索神變真言經卷第十六
translation: Bukong juansuo shenchang zhenyan jing, vol. 16
